metadata.Name: Maknuune
metadata.Description: Maknuune is a large open lexicon for the Palestinian Arabic dialect with over 36K entries from 17K lemmas and 3.7K roots. It includes diacritized Arabic orthography, phonological transcription, and English glosses. Some entries are enriched with additional information such as broken plurals, templatic feminine forms, associated phrases, collocations, Standard Arabic glosses, and examples or notes on grammar, usage, or location of collected entry.
metadata.Paper Title: Maknuune: A Large Open Palestinian Arabic Lexicon
metadata.Abstract: We present Maknuune, a large open lexicon for the Palestinian Arabic dialect. Maknuune has over 36K entries from 17K lemmas, and 3.7K roots. All entries include diacritized Arabic orthography, phonological transcription and English glosses. Some entries are enriched with additional information such as broken plurals and templatic feminine forms, associated phrases and collocations, Standard Arabic glosses, and examples or notes on grammar, usage, or location of collected entry.
